about_the_game:
Key Features:


  • Encounter a vast array of substances, from those inspired by real scientific phenomena to purely imaginative materials, or even ones created just for humor.
  • Substances are represented as square-shaped graphic objects that can be freely moved and combined.
  • Players must discover new combinations in a clever and creative way, much like solving a puzzle.
  • Engage in visual novel-style dialogues with various colleagues as you enjoy the game!

Try Creative Combinations Based On Laws

Stand on the shoulders of giants! To create new materials, study existing laws and then apply them in novel ways to discover new methods of combination.


Interactions between substances, not just direct combinations

It's not just about directly combining materials; the fields generated by the substances can also affect the outcome of your combinations. Keep this in mind as you experiment with different combinations under varying fields.


Report new materials by placing them in the submission slots on the experiment table

On the experiment table, there are submission slots for various new materials that currently only exist in theory. If you create a new material, submit it there to build your reputation and achievements as a scientist.


Academic exchange with colleagues is crucial

Conversations with colleagues researching similar fields can provide clues for synthesizing new materials. Gain insights from your peers through dialogue, and inspire them with your ideas.

name: Eureka! Superconductor Lab

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i3-6100 or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 670 / Radeon HD 7970
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: Eureka! Superconductor Lab is a crafting+simulation game where you synthesize materials and witness the astonishing scientific phenomena. Work alongside scholars, science geeks, and your girlfriend to synthesize the Holy Grail of modern physics: a room-temperature superconductor!
